@graph.caption: Chicken Pad Thai in a black skillet, fresh off the stove, ready to be served.

@graph.name: Pad Thai | RecipeTin Eats
@graph.description: A terrific Pad Thai recipe that truly stacks up to great Thai restaurants yet is totally doable for every home cook! No hunting down unusual ingredients.

@graph.name: Nagi
@graph.description: I believe you can make great food with everyday ingredients even if you’re short on time and cost conscious. You just need to cook clever and get creative!

@graph.name: Pad Thai
@graph.description: Recipe video above. Here's a Pad Thai recipe that really does taste just as good as takeout from good Thai restaurants, and you'll find everything you need at the supermarket. See here for a truly authentic Pad Thai recipe, if that's what you're after - but note that most people find it a little too "real" for their palettes because Pad Thai outside of Thailand is dialled back on the fish sauce/dried shrimp "funk".I use chicken here but feel free to switch with any protein, even prawns/shrimp.
recipeIngredient: 125 g / 4oz   Chang's Pad Thai dried rice sticks ((Note 1))
150 g/5oz   chicken breast (or thigh) (, thinly sliced)
1/2 cup  firm tofu, cut into 3cm / 1 1/4" batons (see photo)
1/4 cup garlic chives , cut into 3cm / 1 1/4" pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Place noodles in a large bowl, pour over plenty of boiling water. Soak for 5 minutes, then drain in a colander and quickly rinse under cold water. Don't leave them sitting around for more than 5 - 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place noodles in a large bowl, pour over plenty of boiling water. Soak for 5 minutes, then drain in a colander and quickly rinse under cold water. Don't leave them sitting around for more than 5 - 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a large non stick pan (or well seasoned skillet) over high heat. Add garlic and onion, cook for 30 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a large non stick pan (or well seasoned skillet) over high heat. Add garlic and onion, cook for 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chicken and cook for 1 1/2 minutes until mostly cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chicken and cook for 1 1/2 minutes until mostly cooked through.

recipeInstructions.text: Push to one side of the pan, pour egg in on the other side. Scramble using the wooden spoon (add touch of extra oil if pan is too dry), then mix into chicken.
recipeInstructions.name: Push to one side of the pan, pour egg in on the other side. Scramble using the wooden spoon (add touch of extra oil if pan is too dry), then mix into chicken.

recipeInstructions.text: Add bean sprouts, tofu, noodles then Sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Add bean sprouts, tofu, noodles then Sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Toss gently for about 1 1/2 minutes until Sauce is absorbed by the noodles.
recipeInstructions.name: Toss gently for about 1 1/2 minutes until Sauce is absorbed by the noodles.

recipeInstructions.text: Add garlic chives and half the peanuts. Toss through quickly then remove from heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add garlic chives and half the peanuts. Toss through quickly then remove from heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, sprinkled with remaining peanuts and lime wedges on the side, with a sprinkle of chilli and a handful of extra beansprouts on the side if desired (this is the Thai way!). Squeeze over lime juice to taste before eating.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately, sprinkled with remaining peanuts and lime wedges on the side, with a sprinkle of chilli and a handful of extra beansprouts on the side if desired (this is the Thai way!). Squeeze over lime juice to taste before eating.
